column4: god why is video drivers such a pain with ubuntu?... i just enabled the desktop 3d support or something like that, and it automaticly downloaded some nvidia driver now it wont start up after the loading bar any ideas how to sort it out?
blame nvidia. :)
kernel versions/driver versions/ often are the sticking point.. what is your exact card?
gainward 6800GS AGP 512 Mb
ok. at least its not an 8800 or some other odd card. :)
as far as odd goes it is a rather odd one since they "never" released 6800GS' with 512 mb in agp, but divers wise no it isnt it works on the normal 6800 drivers just fine
sunray helped me earlyer to get it working with a simmilar problem we edited a file but i'm so new at the whole linux thing i honestly cant rememnber the commands we used
if you used the shell. try the 'history' command. :)
was it editing the /etc/xorg.conf to enable 'Driver 'nvidia'' ?
yep it was and i just typed history it says 1 history
heh..  yea.. all the histories get merged when ya exit. :(
'sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf' :) and look for the Driver 'nv' line - i guess.. Not sure why the restircted-manager tool dident change it for ya.
that doesnt seem to work i seem to remember he told me to use something called "nano edditor"
nano is yet another editor you can use instead of gedit
i just tryed gedit and it didnt work how could i use nano?
nano /etc/X11/xorg.confg
use 'nano' instead of gedit.. and of course you NEED the sudo stuff . its a system file. so you need root access
and get the name of the file right. :) use the <tab> key for name completion
alllrightt... we're learning... good tips
any command to restart from kernel? or just good old power button?
use the icons for reboot......
your windows training is showing. :)
which icons? i couldnt get into ubuntu if u think i'm the the desktop enviroment... i'm in the kernel shell thingy, or DOS as i would call it (lol)
